metadata.synopsis: Wyll avatar reflects on his fate in the endgame.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *The dawn greets you warmly, as if it knows of your victory. The Netherbrain is fallen, and the parasites have gone quiet.*

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *But you know there is work yet to be done. The people will be shaken, the city will hurt.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *You are the Heart of the Gate, a rightful Grand Duke. Your next step determines the leader you'll become.*

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Step out at your father's side. Proclaim your victory, and bask in the cheers.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *Your father is the most beloved man of all Baldur's Gate. He will honour his only son in raucous celebration.*

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Step forward with pride. Proclaim your victory, and bask in the cheers.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Ulder Ravengard is fallen. The people will honour his son, saviour of Baldur's Gate, in raucous celebration.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *They'll gawk at your horns, at your infernal visage. But soon, they'll warmly welcome you as a Grand Duke.*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Just as she promised, Mizora's dissolved your warlock skills. But you are confident nonetheless, for you embody the four pillars of power: Courage, insight, strategy, justice.*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *What will the histories tell of Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard? Will you be called a man of mercy, or a tyrant? Will Baldur's Gate glow as a jewel, or be made a mockery?*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *Will your patron Mizora tarnish your legacy before the Hells snatch your soul?*

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *For now, you take a breath, sure of one thing over all others: You are a man of your own making.*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Going forth, you will prove you embody the four pillars of power: Courage, insight, strategy, justice.*

54.speaker: Player
54.text: The citizens need to grieve. Gather them, and mourn the fallen.

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *You will bow your head for Grand Duke Stelmane - and the countless other victims of Gortash, Orin, and Ketheric, the Dead Three's chosen.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *You will bow your head for Grand Duke Stelmane. Your father, Ulder Ravengard. And all the victims of Gortash, Orin, and Ketheric, the Dead Three's chosen.*

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *Then you can begin restoring the people's trust in their leaders.*

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Approach the remaining patriars and dukes, and decide the best course of action.

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *With your father at your side, you've no doubts that you can restore the Council of Four and the Parliament of Peers.*

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *With all the important players in place, you'll present a united front to the people.*

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *You descend from beloved stock. You've no doubts that you can restore the Council of Four and the Parliament of Peers.*

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Open the gates to all refugees. Baldur's Gate will be sanctuary to all who need it.

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *If your city is to flourish, you must first cut out the tumours Gortash left behind.*

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *You will welcome all comers, regardless of ancestry or appearance. And you will dismiss any Flaming Fist who dares argue against it.*

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Organise a military parade and march the Flaming Fist through the streets.

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *A show of force will reveal you as a mighty commander, one who will keep order when enemies knock upon the gates.*

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *The people will gawk at your horns, at your infernal visage. But soon, they'll warmly welcome you as a Grand Duke.*

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *But you know your work has just begun. Even now, you can feel the heat of the Hells. It is time for a culling.*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *What will be your first act as Blade of Avernus?*

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Find Mizora, and make her pay for what she did to you.

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *Mizora treated you as a pet. She made your soul a mere plaything, and bid you choose between your father and your freedom.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *She's dissolved your warlock skills, just as she promised. But Ansur has blessed you as the Heart of the Gate.*

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *You embody the four pillars of power: Courage, insight, strategy, and justice.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *You will track down the blasted devil. And you will tear her wings and cleave her infernal flesh until her screams are lost in the fires.*

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Train in the bow and the sword, now that Mizora's taken all your powers.

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *Mizora's dissolved your warlock skills, just as she promised. But Ansur has blessed you as the Heart of the Gate.*

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *You will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back. You don't need the Hells' gifts to be mighty.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *From there, you choose the road to follow. The Blade of Avernus, a man of his own making.*

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Consult Mizora. She can point the way to your first infernal victim.

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *Like it or not, you are still chained to Mizora. You can't risk killing a devil whose loyalty is to her mistress, Zariel.*

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *With her blessing, you will fell one fiend, then another. The disloyal will tremble at your sight as you tear your way through Avernus.*

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *Your thoughts turn to your pact. Will Mizora ever stand in your way - and if so, will you dare resist?*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *How soon will your soul be snatched for the Hells' army?*

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Scout for devils and demons hiding on the Coast and destroy them.

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *You will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back. You don't need the Hells' gifts to be mighty.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Under your watch, no demon will harm the people of the Sword Coast, and no wardevil will set it aflame.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *Fiends will see the Blade of Avernus and tremble.*

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *You take a deep breath, sure of one thing over all others: You are a man of your own making.*

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *Avernus' powers still course through you. You will turn them against its own creatures.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Your thoughts turn to Mizora. Will she stand in your way - and if so, will you dare resist?*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *How soon will your soul be snatched for the Hells' army?*

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *For now, you have no answers. But you do have a pledge:*

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Descend to the Hells. Strike down each and every devil and demon you can.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *You will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back. You don't need the Hells' gifts to be mighty.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Fiends will tremble at your sight as you tear your way through Avernus. You will take their horns and tails as your trophies.*

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Under your watch, no demon will harm the people of the Sword Coast, and no wardevil will set it aflame.*

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *Fiends will tremble at your sight as you tear your way through Avernus. You will take their horns and tails as your trophies.*

111.speaker: Narrator
111.text: *Under your watch, no demon will harm the people of the Sword Coast, and no wardevil will set it aflame.*

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Forget Avernus for now. Patrol the frontiers, seeking people to help.

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *You embody the four pillars of power: Courage, insight, strategy, and justice.*

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *You will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back. You don't need the Hells' gifts to be mighty.*

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *The people may not welcome you as a hero. They may see only a devil, frightening and despicable.*

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *But still, you'll persevere. You won't aid them for the glory. You'll aid them because it's right.*

114.speaker: Narrator
114.text: *Avernus' powers still course through you. You will continue to use them to help those who can't help themselves.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *They may not welcome you as a hero. They may see only a devil, frightening and despicable.*

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *But still, you'll persevere. You won't aid them for the glory. You'll aid them because it's right.*

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *Your thoughts turn to Mizora. Will she stand in your way - and if so, will you dare resist?*

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *How soon will your soul be snatched for the Hells' army?*

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *For now, you have no answers. But you do have a pledge:*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *Under your watch, no monster will harm the people of the Sword Coast.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *But you know your work has just begun. The people need a champion. They need the Blade of Frontiers.*

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Find Mizora, and make her pay for what she did to you.

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *She's dissolved your warlock skills, just as she promised. But you will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back.*

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Hunt. Slay monsters and dangerous beasts before they can cause havoc.

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *You embody the four pillars of power: Courage, insight, strategy, and justice.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *You will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back. You don't need the Hells' gifts to be mighty.*

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *You'll fell great beasts and monsters. You'll be hailed as a hero. And you'll march forth with pride, knowing you've earned the right.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *Mizora's dissolved your warlock skills, just as she promised. But you will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *You don't need the Hells' gifts to be mighty.*

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *You'll fell great beasts and monsters. You'll be hailed as a hero. And you'll always wonder if you've earned the right.*

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *You'll fell great beasts and monsters. You'll be hailed as a hero. And you'll march forth with pride, knowing you've earned the right.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *Your thoughts turn to Mizora. Will she stand in your way - and if so, will you dare resist?*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *How soon will your soul be snatched for the Hells' army?*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *For now, there's one thing you can be sure of: The Blade of Frontiers is a man of his own making.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *You'll fell great beasts and monsters. You'll be hailed as a hero. And you'll always wonder if you've earned the right.*

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Patrol the frontiers, seeking people to help.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *When the tyrannised and the tormented cry out, you will listen. No one should suffer at the hands of man or monster.*

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *Mizora's dissolved your warlock skills, just as she promised. But Ansur has blessed you as the Heart of the Gate.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *Mizora's dissolved your warlock skills, just as she promised. But you will triumph with a sword in your hand and a bow at your back.*

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Join the efforts to restore peace to Baldur's Gate.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Help your father restore peace to Baldur's Gate.

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *The citizens of Baldur's Gate will welcome Ravengard's son with open arms.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *They will call you a hero. And you'll march forth with pride, knowing you've earned the right.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *From there, you choose the road to follow. The Blade of Frontiers, a man of his own making.*

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *They will call you a hero. And you'll always wonder if you've earned the right.*
